metadata.title: CVE-2022-1116 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - high
metadata.description:
Integer Overflow or Wraparound vulnerability in io_uring of Linux Kernelallows local attacker to cause memory corruption and escalate privileges toroot. This issue affects: Linux Kernel versions prior to 5.4.189; version5.4.24 and later versions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1116` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-113-generic - 5.4.0-113.127
linux-image-5.4.0-113-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-113.127
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-113-generic - 5.4.0-113.127
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-113-lowlatency - 5.4.0-113.127
No subscription required

linux-image-5.13.0-21-generic - 5.13.0-21.21~20.04.1
linux-image-5.13.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.13.0-21.21~20.04.1
